intro: Sphaeralcea rusbyi, commonly known as Rusby's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Sphaeralcea rusbyi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
